newsitem.title: GERMANY: Gehe eyes new acquistions to boost growth.
newsitem.headline: Gehe eyes new acquistions to boost growth.

text.p: German pharmaceuticals wholesaler Gehe AG, fresh from emerging the winner for UK drugs group Lloyds Chemists, said on Wednesday it planned to expand further and would consider more takeovers.

"Of course we are observing those markets where we are not yet present with our core businesses very carefully. We do not let anything pass us by," Gehe management board chairman Dieter Kaemmerer told the group's annual meeting.
On the other hand Kaemmerer said the company would not rush matters prematurely. "We will not and do not intend to do things in an overly hasty fashion."
Kaemmerer signalled Gehe will likely concentrate on digesting its most recent acquisition this year, refraining from any new takeovers now.
"At least for the rest of the year it looks as if we can fully concentrate on" consolidating and optimising our business.
Gehe acquired Lloyds Chemists in early 1997 and took over some 920 pharmacies. Currently Gehe is in the process of selling off non-core businesses.
"We are confident that we will be able to reduce the price we paid for the group by about one third after having completed the sale," Kaemmerer said.
